Description: Lower lip sherd with turn to cul of Chian, possibly early patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (partly worn) with traces of added white bands; exterior: reserved with traces of brown band near bottom of sherd; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces of the sherd make it difficult to determine to what style it belongs. Early patterned chalices have no decoration on either side of the chalice walls.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 717, no. 752)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0296) (phase 2)
